content: do you want to knit socks but it s still too warm where you live how about a lacy ankle sock this is an intermediate pattern but i ve included some resources below for adventurous beginners or if you need a refresh on some of the skills used you like charts i have charts you hate charts i have written instructions download whichever you prefer or both - there is also a printer friendly version available this pattern has been tested in all sizes but not tech edited **skills** * knitting in the round * provisional cast-on or picking up cast-on stitches * decreasing k2tog ssk sk2p * german short row or other short row method of your choice * heel flap and gusset or substitute whichever heel you prefer * lace chart or written * kitchener stitch **resources** here is a collection of third party resources that i think may be useful when knitting this pattern i am not responsible for the content linked below choosing yarn for socks 1 - laine magazine how to knit a provisional cast-on with a crochet hook 2 - nimble needles joining a folded brim 3 - kelbourne woolens same technique used for the folded cuff how to do the kitchener stitch 4 -
